snippet: The Supreme Court dismissed a lawsuit that had sought to block constitutional changes to presidential term limits, clearing the way for President Paul Kagame to run again.
abstract: Rwanda's Supreme Court dismisses lawsuit by political opposition that sought to prevent removal of presidential term limits; judges say Constitution allows for changes, enabling Pres Paul Kagame to run again.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court dismissed a lawsuit that had sought to block constitutional changes to presidential term limits, clearing the way for President Paul Kagame to run again.

headline.main: Rwanda: Legal Battle on Term Limits
headline.print_headline: Africa; Rwanda: Legal Battle on Term Limits
